NewWords.WordPhrase: n. quickness of movement; hurry 急忙；匆忙
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She made haste to tell her mother the good news.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. be typical of (sb./sth.); be characteristic of 成为…的特征；以…为特征
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Bright colors and bold strokes characterize his early paintings.

NewWords.WordPhrase: in motion; in flight 正在进行中；在飞行中
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He likes to photograph birds on the wing.

NewWords.WordPhrase: influenced by urgency or compulsion; suffering stress 被催逼的；承受压力的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She is constantly under pressure and it is affecting her health.
e.g. Volume 2 of Shaw's Complete Works is missing.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. be a sign of (sth.); mean 表示…的意思；意味
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He signified his content with a nod.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. （使）非常兴奋，（使）非常激动
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We thrilled at the good news.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. 给…加标题（或说明文字等）；为…配字幕
a. that cannot be penetrated by water 不透水的；防水的

NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The explorers ventured forth to discover new land.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. having the same distance between each other at every point 平行的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The railway line runs parallel with the highway.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. decide to do sth.; choose 选择；作出抉择
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They opt for more holiday instead of more pay.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. noisy activity; agitation 喧嚣繁忙；激动不安
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. the buzz of voices in the crowded room

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. state or power of enduring 忍耐力
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The marathon tests a runner's endurance.

NewWords.WordPhrase: it is not surprising that 难怪
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Under such circumstances, it is no wonder that he experiences difficulties.

NewWords.Word: run the risk of/ a risk
NewWords.WordPhrase: do sth. that exposes one to a danger, possibility, etc. 冒（…）危险
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If we don't take more money with us, we run the risk of running out over the weekend.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. prevent sth. from being in effect for a time; hang (sth.) up 暂停，中止；悬，挂
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We suspended the building work during the rain.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. area or region with a particular feature 区域；范围；地带
